item.title: In Gaza, Trump’s Board of Peace met with deep scepticism, little hope
item.content:encoded: In war-ravaged Gaza, residents question whether Trump's Board of Peace will deliver real security.

item.title: US Supreme Court strikes down Trump’s global tariffs
item.content:encoded: The decision is a significant loss to US President Trump on an issue that has been critical for his economic agenda.

item.title: UN emergency food aid in Somalia may halt by April amid severe hunger
item.content:encoded: Families in Somalia pushed to the brink amid severe hunger; urgent food aid needed to avert worsening conditions.

item.title: Ukraine to boycott Paralympic Games ceremony due to Russian participation
item.content:encoded: The International Paralympic Committee has allocated 10 combined slots to Russian and Belarusian athletes.

item.title: Ukraine’s patience with US peace push wears thin as Russia skirts pressure
item.content:encoded: The US is putting too much pressure on Kyiv and not enough on Moscow, says Ukraine’s Zelenskyy after more failed talks.

item.title: A timeline of British royal sagas and scandals down the decades
item.content:encoded: Former prince Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor has been arrested on suspicion of misconduct in Epstein scandal.

item.title: Israeli forces harass Al Jazeera reporter, journalists
item.content:encoded: Israeli forces blocked Al Jazeera and other networks as they filmed Palestinians waiting to go to the Al Aqsa Mosque.

item.title: Thai police disguised in dancing lion costume arrest wanted man
item.content:encoded: Thai police disguised themselves in a ceremonial lion costume to catch a man wanted for burglary.

item.title: RSF killings in Sudan bear signs of genocide, UN says
item.content:encoded: The UN says mass killings by Sudan’s Rapid Support Forces in El Fasher carry the hallmarks of genocide.

item.title: No Ramadan joy, respite for families in Gaza City destroyed by Israel
item.content:encoded: Nisreen Nassar and her family, like many other Palestinians, continue to live in schools and makeshift shelters.

item.title: FIFA and Peace Board pledge to help Gaza reconstruction through football
item.content:encoded: US President Donald Trump says FIFA alone will seek to raise $75m for football-related projects in Gaza.

item.title: UK ex-prince leaves police station after arrest related to Epstein files
item.content:encoded: The UK’s former prince Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor was filmed leaving a police station on Thursday night.

item.title: Tucker Carlson says passport seized, staff interrogated at Israeli airport
item.content:encoded: Israeli officials deny detaining the right-wing figure, calling the questioning routine and conducted to ensure privacy.

item.title: Manchester City vs Newcastle: Premier League – team news, start, lineups
item.content:encoded: City can cut Arsenal's lead to two points with a win, while Newcastle are looking to revive faltering league campaign.

item.title: Palestinian-American killed by Israeli settlers in occupied West Bank
item.content:encoded: A young Palestinian-American man was killed trying to stop Israeli settlers from stealing his sheep.

item.title: Israel blocks Palestinians from attending Ramadan Friday prayers at Al-Aqsa
item.content:encoded: Israel says it will allow only 10,000 Palestinians from the West Bank to enter mosque for holy month tradition.

item.title: Tracking the rapid US military build-up near Iran
item.content:encoded: As tensions between the US and Iran rise, we examine the military assets Washington has deployed to the Middle East.

item.title: Trump’s Board of Peace faces its first test on Gaza
item.content:encoded: Members of Donald Trump’s Board of Peace expressed optimism about peace and rebuilding in Gaza at its inaugural session.

item.title: Venezuela signs amnesty law as families await prison releases
item.content:encoded: Venezuela’s acting president Delcy Rodriguez signed an amnesty law that could free hundreds of political prisoners.

item.title: Gambian Jammeh-era victims seek ‘real justice’ beyond reparations
item.content:encoded: Those who suffered abuses under Jammeh say the ex-leader now comfortably in exile must be held accountable for crimes.

item.title: Bolivia’s ex-leader Morales reappears in stronghold after 7-week absence
item.content:encoded: The public appearance ends rumours that Morales fled the country following the abduction of Nicolas Maduro in Venezuela.

item.title: Is southern Yemen’s next phase being decided on the ground?
item.content:encoded: Security fragmentation and regional rivalries are reshaping power in southern Yemen.

item.title: US jets escort Russian military aircraft out of Alaska’s air defence zone
item.content:encoded: NORAD says aircraft did not enter sovereign airspace and were not considered a threat.

item.title: One killed, 11 injured in Yemen after security forces disperse STC storming
item.content:encoded: Protest erupts after the internationally recognised gov't holds its first session in the southern city of Aden.

item.title: Trump gives Iran 10-15 days to make deal, warns ‘bad things will happen’
item.content:encoded: Donald Trump has warned Iran it has 10 to 15 days to reach a deal over its nuclear program, or “bad things” will happen.
